creator: thanhle@sangtao.net
text:
[View Results Tree] component cannot generate html pages with japanese
char-set(Ex:euc-jp).

Created attachment 27663
Sample Test File

Issue is fixed as of 2.5.1.
Attached a Test Plan that goes to japanese websites:
- One uses SHIFT_JIS
- 2 others uses EUC-JP

Found these sites on:
http://w3techs.com/technologies/details/en-eucjp/all/all

So I close issue.
Regards
Philippe
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com

text:
Working on Bug 49208, I noticed there is really an issue with Japanese characters not being displayed correctly when HTML is chosen as Renderer.

I developped a sample that does what's inside RenderAsHtml and it works outside of JMeter, see attached file.

I think this issue is a real one while 49208 is just a side effect.
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Created attachment 27866
Simple Main that displays Japanese page well

I scratched my head and don't understand why the same code does not display japanese characters in JMeter.

Sebb do you see any explanation ?
Thanks

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Created attachment 27867
Stupid ResultRenderer to avoid relying on Sample and just display hard coded page

Notice the renderer uses same code for getting the URL but displayed result is not the same.

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Issue might be due to this when it was reported:
http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6636983

Now,  Note that I also have a very strange behaviour: 
* I don't reproduce issue Running JMeter in RUN mode with JDK 6:
- 2011/10/30 15:42:11 INFO  - jmeter.JMeter: java.version=1.6.0_26  
- 2011/10/30 15:42:11 INFO  - jmeter.JMeter: java.vm.name=Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 
- 2011/10/30 15:42:11 INFO  - jmeter.JMeter: java.vm.version=20.1-b02-384 


* I get issue running JMeter in DEBUG mode with same JVM (-Xdebug -Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,server=y,suspend=n,address=5050) 

I close it as WORKSFORME.
